qas.question: When were pagan Slavic populations Christianized?
What religion is predominant in the East and South Slavs?
What religion is predominant in the West and western South Slavs?
When did the East-West Schism begin?
The majority of contemporary Slavic populations who profess a religion are what?
What schism began in the 10th century?
Most of what populations are Muslim?
What percentage of Slavs are atheist?
When did Slavic populations become more atheistic?
What nationality is the Protestant religion common in?

context: The pagan Slavic populations were Christianized <a0_0><b8_0>between the 6th and 10th centuries<b8_0/><a0_0/>. <a1_0>Orthodox Christianity<a1_0/> is predominant in the East and South Slavs, while <a2_0>Roman Catholicism<a2_0/> is predominant in West Slavs and the western South Slavs. The religious borders are largely comparable to <b5_0>the East–West Schism<b5_0/> which began in the <a3_0>11th century<a3_0/>. The majority of <b6_0>contemporary Slavic populations<b6_0/> who profess a religion are <a4_0>Orthodox<a4_0/>, followed by Catholic, while a small minority are Protestant. There are minor Slavic Muslim groups. Religious delineations by nationality can be very sharp; usually in the Slavic ethnic groups the vast majority of religious people share the same religion. Some Slavs are atheist or agnostic: only <b7_0>19%<b7_0/> of <b9_0>Czechs<b9_0/> professed belief in god/s in the 2005 Eurobarometer survey.
